main event: A sighting of a thirty-foot long oblong bright orange object in the sky over Long Island, New York on 15 August 1958.
interesting points: The object was observed for 5 minutes,The sighting took place during overcast weather,The object was described as fiery and falling very high,Possible explanations included a navy jet or turbulent air operation,The report concluded the data was incomplete and no admissible conclusion could be given.
sighted object: a thirty-foot long oblong bright orange object
witness description: six adults including a 42-year-old female resident
